Reviews.Title: Just Perfect
Reviews.Author: S. Caldwell
Reviews.Content: After doing the research, we decided on this tv because it fit the bill with the 120 refresh rate, the latest technology with 1080p, etc.  It arrived this morning and after maybe 10 minutes of careful unpacking and attaching the pedestal to the screen it was up and running.Our jaws were on the floor at how amazingly beautiful it is.  The clarity is stunning and 40 inches turned out to be a good size.  Its big enough to appreciate the big game or a blu-ray movie, but not so ostentatious that you can't use it everday for the news and regular programming.We did some shopping around first and Best Buy as of 6/30/08 wanted $1899 for this tv, oh and don't forget to add tax which is 9% here.  All said and done we saved close to $400 by purchasing it on Amazon which makes it seem like we got the Playstation 3 that we also ordered for free.All said and done, it is showstopping even when it isn't on.  The EnergyStar endorsement is a bonus also considering that larger tvs are notorious energy consumers.About The Seller: OneCallWith a large purchase such as this, I was a little reluctant to buy a tv over the internet.  The price couldn't be beat though.Within 12 hours I had an email from their company notifying me of their shipping policies and within 24 hours another email with detailed tracking information.  All of this was also followed up by a personal phone call from a company representative that kept me in the loop.  My tv was shipped by ABF based on a scheduled appointment that was set up ahead of time.  OneCall encourages you to call your motor freight company that they assign if they don't call you first.Ok, key things to know about my shipping experience with this tv-- Again, tv was shipped by motor freight for CURBSIDE delivery.  Meaning that he lowered it to the curb and my husband and I carried it into the house.  It wasn't heavy at all, but needed two people because of the size of the box.- Company would only accept return of the tv in the event that it was damaged during shipping.  When you sign off on the bill of lading, you are instructed beforehand in the emails to note any scuffs, dents or otheriwse damage to the original packing.  There was nothing wrong with my television even though there were a few small scuffs on the box and they were noted.- The tv box came equipped with ShockWatch stickers that were to turn red if the box had been impacted or was mishandled, dropped etc.  The stickers were clear on my box, so they took good care of it from the time of shipping to arrival at my curb.All in all the service was great, the tv works and looks fantastic and I highly reccomend both.____________UPDATE__8/28/10______________________________________________________________2 years and one new house later, this tv is still amazingly beautiful and I'm highly considering buying another one for the guest room upstairs.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV, great value for money
Reviews.Author: Manish Rastogi "Manish"
Reviews.Content: "I've had my 40W4100 for 3 weeks now. I researched, researched and researched until I was worn out. I had narrowed my selections down to this or Samsung. I didn't like the TOC or gloss screen of the Samsung (my den has alot of glare during the day) so I decided on the Sony. And boy am I glad I did! This TV just blows me away! I have everything connected HDMI (Dish Network HD 221, PS3 and Onkyo 606 receiver).  You will NOT be disappointed. You would not believe the WOW factor from my friends when they see it for the first time, and I find myself never wanting to go to bed at night anymore. HAHA....Nothing, and I mean nothing, is ever perfect! I can assure you the Samsung's aren't perfect, either. So from a true 40W4100 owner, BUY THIS TV, you will not regret it!!!!"

Reviews.Title: amazing with rabbit ears!
Reviews.Author: Gerald G. Knapton
Reviews.Content: Since we live so close to Mt. Wilson where the major stations have broadcast antennas we thought we would try it with a basic Terk rabbit ear antenna and it is just amazing!  Gets over 60 digital channels and even the on-air program guide works to give us a list of what is available at listed hours.  Set up was a snap and the clarity is stunning.  Sound is very good.  Our friends who have cable or satellite don't believe that we get this sort of reception and so many channels without paying a monthly charge. This is our 1st 1080p set and we don't have a blu-ray player yet but that will be next. Wonderful TV set. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Just a great LCD HD TV - UPDATE: When not defective ...
Reviews.Author: Jimmy Jones
Reviews.Content: I searched extensively before choosing what would be my new flat screen TV.  I read professionals' and owners' reviews and, in the end, it was either the 40W4100 or the Samsung 630.  I just tought the features of other higher-end models from both companies were not that much significant (but the 120Hz refreshing rate is, in my opinion).  I went to the store (well, a few stores ...) and both product provide just a awesome picture.  Very hard choice I must say, I hesitated and walked around the store like a freak for almost an hour.  Because I owned other Sony products in the past and never had any problem, I decided to pick up the 40W4100. Ho boy, I'm glad I did !!!!  Awesome, really awesome picture!Well, I needed to return the first one I got because of defective pixels (at that price, one stuck pixel is one too much!, but because of the 30-day return policy, Future Shop sent another one quickly, no problem -- tough now I'm frantickly checking if any new defective pixel appears, and I pray, yes I pray that none will appear after my 30-day deadline passed, tough I heard that, in general, most defective pixels will show up quickly, or not at all, hope its true - anyone technically inclined can comment on this???).Just hook up the second one, very easy.  This TV is really amazing!  I just tested this beautiful baby with two blu-ray movie (the first episode of Planet earth, and Polar express) and its just, wow ... I'm out of words ... beautiful ... as you might have heard before, once you tasted HD TV, you will never go back !  (I can't believe I was on tube TV just a few days ago).  I'm hooked up on ordinary cable for now, and the image is pretty bad (but this is expected with a 1080p).  I can't wait to see a hockey game once my HD box is installed !!!Well, my review is not really different from others, but I just wanted to add my general perception of this product.  The KDL-40W4100 is just a great HD TV.  I'm pretty sure the 630 is awesome too (reviews are quite good too) and I must day, for me Samsung has one small advantage -- I wish Sony would provide a swiveling stand like Samsung.Now even if I'm not religious at all, I'm praying that no defective pixel will appear ...*****  IMPORTANT UPDATE (12/31/2008):Well, it's happening again.  Future Shop sent me a replacement, as stated in my review above, and two defective pixels (both stuck on green) appeared within 7 days.  I am soooo pissed.  Two defective TV in a row, can you believe this.  Either I am "Mr Bad Luck" .. or Sony does not care much about the quality of their products.  I mean, two in a row, it is more than random rate !!!  Are you kidding me!  I have a researh lab and I have, in all, 6 LCD screens.  Not one has a single defective pixel, not one.  Now I'm buying this expensive TV and two of their sets in row are defective.  Of course, Sony (and other companies) will tell you that it is not defective and that it is "normal" that a few defective pixels appear.  This is just BS for the masses.  The problem is, big companies like Sony want to cut their expenses at the Quality Assessment Department.  They know most (not all) consumers are too dumb and will let go.  Consumers should not accept this BS.  Let's imagine you buy a brand new car, say a nice BMW.  The seller tell you: "well, sir, it is possible that there are some scratches on the hood or elwhere.  But it is normal, and your car is functioning just fine anyway."  Would you accept this?  No, or course!  I am so pissed at Sony (the 40W4100 is made in Mexico, at first I tought it would be better than crap made in China, but I guess I was wrong).  I'm gonna ask for another (second) replacement, and if there is a problem with defective pixel (even a single one is too much for a product of that price) again within the 30-day period, I will go with the Samsung LN40A630 -- and will not buy a Sony product again.  Too bad because I really like this TV (awesome picture really, looks good too) when it's not defective.  But if Sony does not care about the quality of their products, why should I buy their products.

Reviews.Title: If You Are Looking for Best Price & Features: Look No More!!!
Reviews.Author: C. M. Bradley "CMB"
Reviews.Content: Sony Bravia W4100 Series has the best features for a tv in this price range.  I too looked at the Samsung A650 but am glad I went the Sony.  The remote on the sony is more intuitive, plus I didn't want the glass screen for the room I was going to use it in has a window facing the tv. The picture is amazing and the 120 hz is nice feature (I use it on standard mode not High)The Cinema Motion is great.  The tv looks good in HD and Standard Definition and the picture looks true to life.  The XBR series is alot higher in price but I rather have $700 extra dollars and a very nice tv. This TV is a tough act to follow.

Reviews.Title: A W E S O M E
Reviews.Author: S. Cooper
Reviews.Content: Okay I really have no idea about these sort of things. I had to do a little research before spend that much money on a TV. I asked my very knowledgeable brother who recommended this as one of 15 TVs to look at. I went to Best Buys to see some of the models in action and liked the quality of this model but it was not what I wanted to spend and they would not price match off of a website. So I went to Amazon and found a great deal and free shipping from OneCall. Not to mention that OneCall was fast and easy to deal with. I could not tell you the specs of this TV but the picture and sound are (wait for it) awesome. I put in the Matrix after a relatively easy set up just to see, and there was no picture blurring the 120hz (okay this is one of two specs that I know) made a huge difference.  It is a good looking TV, its nice to have a good picture along with something aesthetically pleasing (can't help it I'm an art student)  and the picture is AMAZING for movies.I know after reading SO many reviews that Sony is not know for its Black quality, if that is really important yo may not want to get this TV but I really can not tell unless there was a plasma TV next to it. I do not have HD cable but the picture is pretty darn good. I think I may have to step it up and get HD now. I have always loved Sony so glad this is no exception. -The Handy Dandy Girl

Reviews.Title: a GREAT TV !!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Warren E. Greenwald
Reviews.Content: SONY BRAVIA W-SERIES KDL-40W4100 LCD TV.After reading all the reviews I could find on the web, we looked at sets in TV stores and decided that the SONY was what we wanted. I went to the SONY web site and reviewed the features of all their models and sizes, size of screen vs viewing distance, etc, etc. I am a retired Engineer and of course studied as much info and personal opinions as I could find. Consumers Union Magazine is always a great source of technical features, quality of product and failure history. As reported by others, my TV was hand carried into my house. They were ready to unpack and assemble it for no additional charge, but I chose to do that myself. With the help of a friend, we assembled and set it up. All features worked perfectly. I made some video and sound adjustments to our personal liking. Super easy to follow the "on screen menu" for all features. A FANTASTIC picture with EXCELLENT sound. Not inexpensive, BUT if you desire the best, I believe this is IT!There were even more expensive SONY models, but the additional features for the extra money were not worth it to me. Watching sporting events is NOW better than being there. National Geographic specials "come alive" in HD on this set. EVERYTHING is more PLEASING and INTERESTING to watch in HD on this set !!!!! A special technical SONY feature on this model makes rapid motion across the screen SMOOTH!!! If you watch sports or racing, check this out on other sets and see the difference. Do I sound like a satisfied customer??

Reviews.Title: The picture is mind-boggling
Reviews.Author: Derek P. Claxton
Reviews.Content: I've had my eye on an HD set for some time now. I've investigated other brands, the options available on sets, the pros and cons. The websites that I visited seem to have a very high rating for the Sony KDL-40W4100, even to the point of saying that the television has one of the best pictures across the board. I eventually decided to invest in this Sony product. And boy was it a great choice. The digital stations come in with incredible clarity and detail. The number and type of A/V inputs was also very appealing. I also invested in a HD Sony receiver and blue ray player. Although the HDMI cables are incredibly expensive, it is well worth it for the picture (and the digital audio). There are so many options on this tv that I haven't investigated all of them. The only draw back to this set is the learning curve for this kind of technology (which may be higher for me, not being technologically inclined). A very interesting option that stands out is the "Cinemotion", which I think is only available on the W series. I'm not exactly sure how to describe it, but it almost gives the video a 3D look. While it's pretty cool, this aspect may take some getting use to if you decide to use it. All in all, I'm very happy with the television: crystal clear picture, lots of detail, no motion blurring (thanks to the 120Hz picture cycling). Compared to other LCD sets, this would stand out at the top in my opinion. In fact, I see very little to no advantage of upgrading to the XBR series. At least, not yet.

Reviews.Title: Great Television
Reviews.Author: D. Tapp "Love-my-Sony"
Reviews.Content: This Sony really stands out.  I don't think you can find another brand with a better picture in a 40".  I hooked to a regualar cable box and I'm recieving beautiful HD channels with great clarity.  I wish I had bought one sooner.  I highly recommend this TV

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: B. Berger
Reviews.Content: After much internet research I ordered the TV from Amazon.com.  The price was great, the delivery flawless and the product is exactly what it is cracked up to be.

Reviews.Title: A "Best in Class" HDTV
Reviews.Author: Mitchel Martin
Reviews.Content: WOW! We put off purchasing an HDTV for a long time because of the picture motion issues, granularity of the screen, etc. This 120hz Bravia is another example of Sony's commitment to producing the best HDTV on the market.And 10 stars to Amazon.com for providing such a great selection and service!!! We tried to purchase this TV locally at an Ultimate Electronics, but the sales people were never available, rude and wouldn't give us a decent price.  So we purchased it through Amazon and saved about $400, which paid for cables,a DVD player and extended warranty (that we purchased separately through Sony.com)And a note about CEVA - they delivered this TV 5 days ahead of the scheduled delivery date! Plus the driver helped me carry the TV into the house and offered to help me unpack the unit to ensure there was no damage to the TV. My purchase experience from start to finish was nothing short of a pleasure - don't hesitate to purchase this HDTV...

Reviews.Title: Holy Crap!!!!
Reviews.Author: Joseph Franks "J. Franks"
Reviews.Content: I was able to get this TV for 1098 shipped using Ebay's buy it now along with live search.  At the time live search was allowing you to save 25% up to 200.00. At the 1298 price tag it was a great deal, but with the extra 200.00 off it's an absolute steal.  My only beef is with the company I bought it from "Pyxis Camera" they constantly gave me the run around and it took almost 3 weeks to get the TV from date of purchase, but I have it now and it was totally worth the wait.It took me almost 3 weeks of constant fiddling to get the picture the way I wanted it, but that's because it has so many features and settings.  That's a positive note for me as I prefer to have more settings and features so I can get the picture exactly how I want it.  I set it to vivid as I felt that gave me the blackest blacks and the whitest whites.  I then turned the color down as everybody looked as though they had a Hollywood tan and I prefer more natural skin tones.  I also turned off the noise reduction as when it was on people tended to look soft.  I turned on the mpeg noise reduction as it helps reduce the pixellation you get when the camera pans.  I turned off cinemotion as well as I do not like the effect it creates.I also use this as my primary computer monitor as its hooked up to a htpc.  I play 1080p mkv files and they are ridiculous, smooth as butter.  If you are familiar with the scene in the Dark Knight where the hospital blows up the explosion itself is extremely clean. I have looked at it from literally inches away looking for the slightest imperfection with the fast motion associated with an explosion and I can't find one flaw.  Kinda makes me wonder what that 120hz is really doing because as a computer monitor it will only operate at 60hz.  If you use it as a computer monitor you cannot have cinemotion on as it causes slight hesitations due to the 60hz refresh not the 120hz refresh.  On the computer input I do have game mode turned on as that's supposed to help and it does make a positive noticeable difference.Is the 120hz worth it?  I don't have a V series to compare it to so I cannot say for sure. If you can find a way to get it for the 1098 I paid I would say go for it, but if you pay closer to the 1300.00 on-line or 1700.00 at Best Buy you may want to re-consider.  Maybe get the V series instead and spend the difference on a blu-ray player or a good receiver.I really cannot say enough as to how amazing this TV really is, if your still on the fence contact me at jsf29@nau.edu and I will do my best to answer any questions you may have.

Reviews.Title: One of The Best Flat Tv Ever
Reviews.Author: Enrique Schmilinsky
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV just reading the reviews left in here because I work overseas. In the moment I was placing the order had my doubts, whether it will work the way they were saying. I trusted and bought it without telling to my wife.5 days after, the TV arrived home, my wife was yelling at the phone that a big box got home with a TV, she waited for me to mount it on the wall, when I turned on, everybody at home shut up, we're hypnotized by the image quality, the sound, it is impressive such technology mounted on my wall.Now we gather every night to watch a movie or TV, it's incredible, 100% recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: Terrific so far.
Reviews.Author: William J. Greggs "Bill"
Reviews.Content: Have had the Sony Bravia W-Series KDL-40W4100 40-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV for a month now and it's met all expectations for beautiful picture, sound and flexibility to handle all kinds of inputs.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia, great
Reviews.Author: Johnnie R. Walerowicz "Johnnie"
Reviews.Content: Sony Bravia W-Series KDL-40W4100 40-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV, item arrived very quick, best price for TV, saved $300.00 over Sears, picture is beautiful with 480i and unbeliveable in 1080i, would not buy another TV unless sony. perfect, So far great dealing with Amazon, buy with confidence...

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: R. Huerto
Reviews.Content: I did hours of research comparing this TV and the Samsung A650 and although both seem the same in features I chose the Sony because I have all Sony products, PS3, Blu-Ray player and camera. This TV blew my mind when I watched Iron Man on Blu-Ray. The 120hz motion flow and cinema settings was by far the best I've ever seen on a HDTV. The menus and options are easy to use and setup.

Reviews.Title: Sony KDL-40W4100, What's Not To Like
Reviews.Author: K. Perkowski
Reviews.Content: What an experience, my first HDTV and my first purchase from Amazon.  The TV is simple to set up, easy to install and a breeze to operate. The  instructions are very easy to understand and the remote is uncluttered and simple to use.  I am amazed by the picture, and when paired with a Sony Home Theater System the experience is incredible.  It has been the perfect choice for me to enjoy in my retirement.I can't say enough about Amazon either.  The price was so good that I had to triple check to make sure I was looking at the right item, plus no tax and free shipping.  I ordered on a Thursday and Monday morning smiling delivery personnal brought it in the house for me.  This isn't service like it used to be, it is service like it never was before.Two thumbs up for Sony and Amazon, I've never had it better.

Reviews.Title: Is it possible to fall in love with your tv?
Reviews.Author: W. Dietrich "WD"
Reviews.Content: I have had my Sony now for 2 weeks. I have felt like I am walking on the air since the day I replaced my old tv.  The sony is shiny and slender and the picture is incredible. It was easy to install and connect my new sony dvd player.  Watching a movie on dvd is like being at the theater.  The only negative is the sound is only ok, but if you spend this much on a tv you will most likely want to add surround sound.The cost is great so quit looking you can not find it cheaper.  My Best Buy had the sale price at $1599 plus tax.This tv is so good that I would suggest that Sony offer a money back promise.

Reviews.Title: Stunning clarity; beautiful picture
Reviews.Author: Beanie
Reviews.Content: After purchasing a Sony Bravia 46XBR4 for our family room, I decided to upgrade our master bedroom TV to HD as well (once you go HD you never go back!)  I thought the downgrade from the Bravia X series to this would be, well, just that - a downgrade.  I was happily proved wrong!  This TV features a stunningly crisp picture, vivid colors, no pixelation problems and unlike OP's, I get great clarity even w/o the HDMI cable.  It is an absolutely gorgeous TV at a reasonable-for-HD price. Set up was easy, the tools menu could be a little easier to navigate, but none of that will matter once you've seen its true beauty.  The integrated sound system is also really good. I have not missed the X-series Bravia features at all, to be honest. You cannot go wrong with this purchase.I bought mine tax-free at a military base so I can't comment on delivery/price of this, but I will say that overall, Amazon's prices are the best and I have used the white-glove delivery for other items and loved it.  I would not hesitate to Amazon it had I not had access to the base.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia W-Series 40-inch LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Ross A. Dinwiddie "rdinwid"
Reviews.Content: This HDTV is awesome! The picture stands out when viewing all types of video. I also purchased a Sony Upscaling DVD player that makes my existing DVD collection like brand new. Brilliant color, smooth transitions. This television is great. I have had it for about a month and enjoy watching it every day.

Reviews.Title: Few problems
Reviews.Author: R. Howe
Reviews.Content: I bought this KDL-40W4100 a few weeks ago.  It looks awesome when using HDMI inputs.  But of course looks even worse than a regular TV when viewing non-HD sources (as with any HDTV).  My two real complaints are:there are only 2 audio outputs from the TV: optical digital and stereo RCA-jacks.  This will only support 2 external speakers (not center or surround sound).  Bummer, as the TV's tiny speakers are quite lame.And problem #2 is:  the base stand that came with the TV is not level!  Ridiculous!  This precision-engineered widescreen HDTV now sits 1/4" higher on one side because the stand isn't level!  So now I have to put a pad of Post-It notes under the left side.Overall, this is a nice TV, but I'm still disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great set, good value, seems future-proof
Reviews.Author: E. Ravage
Reviews.Content: This was my first TV purchase in almost 20 years, so I am hardly an early adopter. However my wife and I do consider ourselves tech-savvy. In a new TV we wanted something of moderate (no more than 42") size with the latest (useful) specifications like 120hz and QAM tuning, and a set that seemed adaptable to future developments like internet movie streaming. Sony had been offering specials in late 2008 so the timing seemed right. The picture is very true, and it works well under all lighting conditions. Because of the QAM tuner we were able to scan all available public access digital stations from our Comcast basic cable (i.e. no set-top box) wire, so we did not have to get a splitter and a separate Digital TV antenna. The remote is simple, and the on-screen menus are detailed but straightforward. So far, so good!

Reviews.Title: Luv it!!
Reviews.Author: Jarvijarv
Reviews.Content: Everything i had hoped it to be!  After careful research, this Sony 40" LCD was the one for my room.  The picture is superb and with the Sony Soundbar and Subwoofer, completes my personal home theater system.  Works flawlessly with my Playstation 3 and Xbox 360.  Blue Ray movies are a sight to behold!!  100% completely satisfied!!!

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: TV-a-holic
Reviews.Content: Received the Sony Bravia tv that I ordered on time and in good condition.  Driver was very courteous and plugged in tv to make sure it was working but despite what Amazon said he would do, he did not put it on the stand or hook anything up.  I did all the labor but it was not really any problem at all.  Directions were very easy to follow and understand to set tv up but be sure you read them all the way through before you start or you may have to reset again from beginning.  Picture was absolutley beautiful in hi def.and the sound really dynamic...lots of choices to tweek the picture and sound but not really neccessary right now.  Did'nt even have to upgrade to a cable box but just went right into tv and picked up even more stations than I was getting before, including digital and many in hi def.  Some really cool features include the tv guide selection on the remote control, but it took about 2 weeks for it to finally load up and work properly instead of the 24-48 hrs Sony said but my guess is that it was a cable issue.  All is working well and I hope will continue for a long time but I've only had it for a month and electronics can be tricky.  Not sure if I will get the extended warranty but I probably will in time.  I researched a long time to find the right lcd flat screen for me and I think I picked a winner.  Works great with the vcr/dvd player I already had. It's my first flat screen and my first purchase from Amazon.  Saved big bucks over brick and mortor stores. I would do it again , but only from Amazon with I think a little better service.

Reviews.Title: Just as expected!
Reviews.Author: Michael Shefelbine "Michael S."
Reviews.Content: I have owned this television for two weeks now and love everything about it.  My PS3 and HD DVR look beautiful on display (HDMI hook ups).  I have had no problems with it thus far and the television is performing to the standards that I was expecting. It is a great television for the price considering it has 120hz technology. I would recommend this television to anyone looking for a great picture and size, that does not want to pay a lot of money.  Deffinitely a great value!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with Viewing Angle
Reviews.Author: D. McCoy
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this TV except for the limited viewing angle.  Its not horrible, but as you move away from viewing center, the color immediately begins to wash out.  I was hoping this didn't happen until after about 45 degrees.  I certainly didn't notice this in the store.  If I had, I wouldn't have bought it.  I have since returned the TV to Amazon (they were very cooperative) and purchased a Panasonic Plasma which has been fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Great Experience for a Greater TV
Reviews.Author: M. Floyd
Reviews.Content: The freight tracking, delivery and set up was excellent. The only thing better is the TV itself. Pardon the lack of specifics, but we could not be happier with the quality.  Thanks Amazon!!

Reviews.Title: good buy
Reviews.Author: fish guy "mark"
Reviews.Content: After tons of research I bought this sony mostly due to the great reviews and I am totally pleased.  Even with lo-def satellite signal the picture is great and the sound is better than some reviews led me to believe.  I have never owned a sony product I didn't like but this tv is a gem.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Plmcrzy
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice television. No problems with delivery or set up. Picture is great. The only drawback is that the stand is unlevel and has to have shim to level the tv. From what I've read that has been a complaint from others.

Reviews.Title: excellent !
Reviews.Author: Kenneth I. Douglas
Reviews.Content: I ordered a KDL40W4100 SONY LCD tv on line sept.22 08 and recieved it in perfect condition on the morning of sept.24 08. AMAZON shipped it FREE by CEVA to my home .The driver was very friendly and courteous as of today I am totally satisfied with SONY AMAZON and CEVA  KEN DOUGLAS Hardyville Ky.

Reviews.Title: Just buy it!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This tv is smart, easy to set up and has everything you would want in a 40 lcd tv. Multiple HDMI, great sound, great color and picture (I don't think we changed the default setting at all since it was perfect) plus it works great with other sony products. If you put a dvd into your sony dvd player the tv turns itself on and switches to the dvd input. Also the input screen is great, there is no guess work. Every component you plug in is highlighted so you and other people using your tv don't have to guess which input is what like most input screens. Sync is also great because we don't even use our dvd player remote since the tv has all the essential buttons for it built in.

Reviews.Title: Any TV you get will be obsolite in a week....
Reviews.Author: Dylan Cassard "Film Nut"
Reviews.Content: But if you buy this one, I can guarantee you will be happy for a long time!I bought this TV six months ago and I am incredibly happy with it. I've got a PS3, a Dreamcast, a Wii and a Pioner CLD-D702 LaserDisc player hooked up to it along with a nice surge protector (I live in San Francisco in an apartment with really old wiring).I immediately fell in love with the ability to calibrate the TV for each individual device. Instead of having long reference lists of sharpness, contrasts and hues for each one. A small deal, but it makes a hell of a difference between so many previous gen devicesPS3- Looks fantastic, but that's pretty much a no-brainer.Wii- It doesn't fair well without happy component cables.LaserDiscs- If you have any in CAV format, you're in for a treat! Because the CAVs 30fps interacts quite nicely with the 120Hz motion flow. My jaw was on the floor when I first watched Akira.I went with this instead of an XBR because I thought this was the best looking model on the floor in terms of realism. Planet Earth looked better on this TV than any other. I was allowed to calibrate each Bravia in the store, and the x.v. color just seemed like a pointless extra at the time. But I am about to purchase a new Canon Vixia HV20 and it has the capacity for x.v. color and the Bravia KDL-40W4100 does not. But c'est la vie mechanique, n'est pas?So if you care about x.v. color, shop bigger. But I don't think the average person will really miss it.

Reviews.Title: Really Enjoying This TV
Reviews.Author: Jon B. Froderberg
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived before the estimated date and in perfect condition. Everything was complete and in the box, and setup was very easy. We are really enjoying the HD picture quality and the 120Hz frame rate really makes a difference.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product, excellent service.
Reviews.Author: J. Staley
Reviews.Content: Product arrived in two days, and is an excellent product at a price hundreds of dollars less than at retail stores in the Atlanta area.

Reviews.Title: My 1st 1080p HDTV
Reviews.Author: H. Hampton "Hot Honda"
Reviews.Content: This Sony Bravia 1080p 120Hz W-Series 40 inch is the best gift I've purchased for myself in years. Though technology is continuously advancing I purchased at a time when this item was at it's lowest just above $1,000. Because just about everyone else purchased their huge LCD HDTV's too early my "little" 40 inch is MORE advanced than theirs. This set has an AUTO adjust - meaning I was watching a regular DVD and the set auto adjusted to full screen. It also auto adjusted the cable HD channels to full screen the first time and it just stays full screen. The Cable HD channels are wonderfully clear and crisp however the 120Hz does not kick in. I think it's because the networks are not that advanced enough just yet. So it's just the 1080p HD that's at work. BUT when watching a Blu Ray DVD or playing the PS3 games THAT's when I can CLEARLY see the 120Hz working. I purchased special 120Hz HDMI 12 foot cables 10.3GBPS (from Amazon only $14 or $15) to ensure the picture quality is not lost. The picture is bright and very colorful. As technology advances this set will last through a few years because of the 120Hz. So it's a great buy for today, especially before the stock market bounces back!

Reviews.Title: Easy buy.  Great TV.
Reviews.Author: R. Turpin
Reviews.Content: The TV is working great.  The price was the best I found.  The shipping was ontime.  Bought from J&R.;  No problems.

Reviews.Title: I could ask for MORE!
Reviews.Author: D. Lloyd
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this LCD TV. One of the smartest buys I have ever bought in my 31 years on planet earth ay a great price ($1,219)...PROS: This LCD has great sound. I don't need a surround sound system for it (it's located in my bedroom). It has plenty of features (so you won't get bored). The design is sleek so is the interface. This TV also connects to the internet (by ethernet) and there are plenty of things to keep me busy using that feature (Amazon HD movies, YouTube, Yahoo, etc.).CONS: They could have put the connections along the sides of the television instead of being directly on the back. My wall mount blocks some the connections. You do need to have this TV connected to the internet to receive updates, which is a plus or minus depending on how you look at it. To me it's a plus!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Money!
Reviews.Author: L. Parr
Reviews.Content: The Sony W Series TV is Great!  Really nice picture, was easy to set up...just too many gadgets on it for me but my fiancee loves it!!  The only complaint we would have is that the sound kind of goes up and down right in the middle of whatever is on at the time.  My fiancee thinks he set the right control...but it still seems to do it.

Reviews.Title: Sony LCD
Reviews.Author: Tom "Tom"
Reviews.Content: There are four reasons I bought the Sony LCD TV. The Sony name, front-facing speakers,120 hz processor and the low price featured by Electronics Expo. The picture quality is terrific and am therefore very satisfied with my Amazon transaction.  Getting free shipping was a nice bonus. Also liked the opportunity to get an inexpensive HDMI cable from Amazon although the handling and shipping cost seemed high for the cost of the product.

Reviews.Title: Sensational with Playstation 3, Blu-ray, DVD, and anything else you watch
Reviews.Author: Brian D. White "Lightning05"
Reviews.Content: The picture quality of this TV is absolutely extraordinary. Not only are colors vibrant, lifelike, and highly detailed in its gorgeous 1080p True HD, but the 120hz Motionflow technology makes the events you witness on screen literally come alive. If I had to choose two words to describe the picture quality of this TV, I would choose "smooth" and "breathtaking." Anything from a hummer chase in the Blu-ray version of The Incredible Hulk, to an intense firefight in Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare for the PS3, to a ginger stroll in the DVD (season 1) version of House, to mammoth images of New York skyscrapers in the HD broadcast version of Good Morning America, this TV will cause you to be completely impressed by the brilliance of its picture and the seamless quality in which the images are presented to you. Every person I have shown this TV to has been blown away by the quality of the picture and the nearly-3D effect produced by the 120hz Motionflow technology.I was also pleasantly surprised by the tv's remarkable sound quality. The detail of the sound, when combined with the TV's smooth and breathtaking picture quality allows you to truly be transported into the world of whatever it is you're watching.Another pleasant surprise came from the "TV Guide" function of the TV. Since I am a standard (non-digital)cable subscriber, I am, at the push of a button on the TV's remote, able to access a specialized menu which allows me to see all of my channels, the programming which will be on them, the time they will be on, and programs that will be on later in the day. This is not to be confused with cable's "TV Guide Channel"--this is an entirely different APPLICATION which works with the TV. The channel menu screen is similar to what you would see on a satellite channel menu--giving you the freedom to see what is on and allowing you to, with great speed, highlight the channel you want to go to, press enter, and be transported to that channel.If you want a TV with breathtaking picture quality, amazingly smooth transitions between images, great sound quality, and (if you're a standard, non-digital cable subscriber) a nifty TV Guide application, then you will be absolutely thrilled with this TV. I've now had this TV for almost a month, and I am impressed by something new everyday. This TV has given new life to my older DVDs, my ultra-modern Blu-rays, my beloved PS3 games, and my favorite shows on primetime television. In other words, this TV has revolutionized the way I experience visual entertainment.

Reviews.Title: A great TV
Reviews.Author: Show-me Jim
Reviews.Content: I have now owned this TV for a month and have yet to find any problems. We receive the local TV stations by antenna, all of which are broadcasting digital signals, but not always in high definition, but even the non-HD digital pictures look good.  When the broadcast is in high definition the picture is dramatically sharp, with excellent black levels, accurate colors and contrast.  I cannot imagine having any better sound from any TV without hooking it up through a stereo receiverBefore purchasing this TV I made many trips to local stores to compare the pictures of the different brands of televisions, always finding the Sonys to have the best pictures, or at least tied with other brands.  The Sony reputation and having the TV Guide feature and PIP won me over.I considered getting a plasma, as was worried about the reported LCD motion blurring problem.  However, in the stores the pictures on most of the plasma televisions always seems to be a little dull visually, lacking the dramatic "punch" of the LCD picture.  Therefore, I decided to get a LCD TV with 120 Hz refresh rate.  However, in reality my experience is that motion blur does not seem to be an issue with LCD televisions.  For me it's difficult to tell whether the 120 Hz feature is turned on or off.After reading the Cnet.com review on this TV, which mentions sudden darkening and brightening of the backlight in certain situations, I was a little apprehensive.  However, after several hours of watching the TV over the past month, we have yet to experience any such problem.  Also, we have yet to see any white dot sparkles, which have been mentioned by some reviewers. A Sony firmware update very possibly fixed this.  I downloaded the update from Sony's web site a couple days after we received the TV.Yes, you might pay a little more for the Sony brand name, but with Sony you usually get what all consumers want, a good quality product.  In conclusion, I definitely recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great television at great buy!!!
Reviews.Author: Mark C. Foskey "hondacbr"
Reviews.Content: Great picture, great volume and fits well in not so big great room. Only had for a couple of weeks. Remote is easy to use. Nothing but praise at this point.

Reviews.Title: It's a Winner
Reviews.Author: DMACRIA "DMACRIA"
Reviews.Content: After lots of shopping and price/feature comparisons I settled on the Bravia W4100 and have been using it for about three months now. It is performing essentially flawlessly in all regards and is still a bargain for what it is and how well it does it for regular and high def TV and 480p DVDs. It's only weakness is that which all LCDs share, less than perfect black/contrast compared to plasma. But in that regard it is equal to or better than any other LCDs I've seen. Certainly the image quality in color accuracy, detail, depth are exceptional. The 120Hz refresh rate is a treat when watching live sports as there is no real lag or latency. Even the old B&W; WWII archieve film footage looks better on this set than ever before. You can't go wrong with this model. At a price point under $1,300 (not to mention free shipping and set-up)it's a true bargain for what you get.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia w series KDL 40 inch 1080p LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Carl Era
Reviews.Content: I was initially nervous about ordering a TV online but after doing the research on which product to buy I found Amazon's price was much better than regular stores. The delivery service as fantastic, it arrived 5 days earlier than the initial date given and the company kept me informed through out the process. I won't hesitate to use them again.. The TV is great, picture quality excellent on HD TV and on a par with conventional cathode ray on regular transmissions ( which is probably state of the art with current technology)I had read some reviews with gripes about the sound but I have no problems with it.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Pam
Reviews.Content: This TV has a very good picture.  I purchased an HDTV several years ago to replace our 37" tube TV that was going out.  We chose the size based on what would fit in our entertainment center.  Due to the wider landscape, what we ended up with was a 27" screen.  The TV we purchased was the Best Buy brand Insignia.  The picture was terrible!  We got an HDTV converter box hooked up from our cable company and that helped a little.  But every time I looked at that TV and thought about how much money we spent on it, it made me sick.  I'm happy to say this Sony TV has a great picture.  I'm  not particularly electronically savvy, so I'm sure it does a whole lot more than I know about at this time.  But I'm learning, and so far I really like what I see.I was really happy too with the delivery.  The company Amazon hired, Pilot Freight Services, called to schedule the delivery, delivered it when they said they would and helped set it up to the point where my husband could make sure it worked.  And then me and my husband were able to hook it up to the cable, DVD player and VCR.

Reviews.Title: Sony made Perfection
Reviews.Author: Dr. K
Reviews.Content: All around this is a great tv. Before we purchased this, we spent about 3 months researching. We must've considered over 20 different tvs. When a deep discount appeared online, we went for the Sony. We have always liked Sony products, and the Sony tvs we saw in-store were by far the best. When the tv arrived via Ceva shipping, we hooked it up to our HD cable box, and wow! The picture came alive! The colors are rich, the motion is exceptionally smooth because of Motionflow 120hz, and the sound is mind-blowing. This tv is worth every penny, and it also broadcasts standard def. channels quite well. If you are looking for a high-quality, stylish tv for a medium size living room, go for it. There is no mistake when buying the Sony w4100.

Reviews.Title: Bravia W series is damn good
Reviews.Author: Denis Blot
Reviews.Content: The Sony Bravia W series pretty much met all my expectations and even surpassed a few.  It took me a while to sort out all its capabilities, thought the manual is pretty easy to guide through.  Love its different picture modes, especially "Cinema" which softens the picture to look like you would see it in a movie theatre, though some of the others you basically have to play around with and decide which one you like the best (or you can use the "custom" function and design your own).  You definitely need a secondary person to help you connect the base to the tv monitor and if the TV is more than 40 inches or you have kids you should probably make sure the tv is fastenened securely to a wall or larger base so that it does not easily tip over.

Reviews.Title: The best picture I've ever seen
Reviews.Author: Eric Smith
Reviews.Content: I just got this TV today, and my god, does it have a great picture.  With motionflow turned on high, sports games look incredibly smooth, and there are zero artifacts.  I'm going to have to get a blu-ray player, or an upconverting dvd player, because my old yamakawa dvd player (using s-video or component) just doesn't look very good anymore on this massive 1080p TV.The television's GUI is also great.  The graphics are crisp, and the menus move quickly.  Also, lots and lots of settings.My only minor gripe is that the speakers could be bigger and stronger.  I'll probably get an Onkyo 7.1 home theather setup with an HDMI repeater to maximize the sound on this thing.Buying it through amazon was great, too.  No shipping, no sales tax so it was much more reasonable than in-store competitors.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Television
Reviews.Author: Happy Amazon'r
Reviews.Content: I researched LCD televisions for several months before finally deciding on the right one for my home.  I decided on the Sony Bravia as they are one of the leaders in the industry and I loved the picture quality in the stores.Once I got the television home, I unpacked and installed the base, very simple, four screws (you will need two people to complete this step to reduce the risk of dropping your beauty).  The connections are simple, straightforward and easily accessible.The picture is to die for.  The motionflow technology is truly amazing watching sports, specifically college football (I got the TV just in time to watch Georgia Tech beat Georgia in Athens - GO JACKETS).  Sorry, I digress.....Overall, I am very satisfied with the set and would highly recommend it to anyone in the market for a superb mid level television.

Reviews.Title: Great Experience!
Reviews.Author: Q. Tan "GietDual"
Reviews.Content: I just bought it last week. And it was amazing how the picture and color and everything! It was delivered by CEVA and very much on time. The driver carried the TV upstairs to my apartment with me and carefully placed it on the stand. After I have tested and everything looked ok, and after I have signed the paperwork, he waited there in patience. Watched the rest the of the Olympics in excitement.Great Experience! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: My experience
Reviews.Author: William Clark
Reviews.Content: I have had many makes and sizes of flat panel tvs over the past several years and I recently purchased the Sony KLD-40W4100 for my cottage. I have used it now for about 1 month and it is by far the best Tv I own or ever had, it has superior contrast and color, as well as great high definition. I would recommend this model for anyone interested in the best 40" tv on the market.

Reviews.Title: Happy with my Sony
Reviews.Author: Mac Souper
Reviews.Content: Product arrived early and was easy to set up on my own.  I did lots of research and the product provided all I was looking for.  Picture is great and it has many features that provide flexibility for the future.

Reviews.Title: total rubbish
Reviews.Author: bradey
Reviews.Content: This set performed adequately for only 2 1/2 years, then it developed horizontal white lines across the entire panel and three inch purple squares across the bottom of the screen.  Sony tech support suggested a service center which I called and was told the set is not worth fixing.  Sony offered to replace it with a refurbished unit for $340, but I went with a new Samsung instead.  This is an inferior product and definitely not worth the premium price.

Reviews.Title: not as good as samsung
Reviews.Author: Nathan Stubbs "newton"
Reviews.Content: everyone looked green!  did everything I could think of to adjust the color including using test patters to adjust the grey scale and still skin tones where greenish. went to cnet and they to commented in there review that skin tones were not as accurate as they should be and slightly greenish.  I gave up sold it and got a samsung 630b !  samsung was on a totally new level of color accuracy and brightness!  even non hd channels on the samsung looked much sharper then the sony.sony has lost me as a customer!  what happened sony?

Reviews.Title: Going well now for over a year...
Reviews.Author: W. Chandler
Reviews.Content: Had very good luck with this TV. Using HDMI for cable box & blu-ray, both VGA and HDMI for PC, cable for broadcast digital, and composite and component for gaming, all appear great. Difference with 1080p source is noticeable. Wish it had 120khz, but for the price I paid I am quite happy.-----------update Jan 2013-----------Still very happy with the purchase. While an entry level product for the Sony line, I've not had any problems with this unit, unlike so many other bargain basement HDTV's people bought over various black Friday sales.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia W-Series KDL-40W4100 40-Inch 1080p 120Hz LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Victor Trang
Reviews.Content: This TV is just awesome! I've had it for almost 8 months now and I haven't had any problems. The picture and sound quality is great. It was light enough to hang on my brick fireplace. It's even better if you have a blu-ray player. The 120hz motion flow technology gives a clean crisp and bright picture. What's even better is that you can connect the TV to the internet and watch videos and movies online. So many functions are available for this TV and I am very happy with my purchase. I recommend this and guarantee you will not have any regrets!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Charlie B
Reviews.Content: We bought this  TV from Amazon based on the reviews. The TV is great. Picture with cable is outstanding. The sound is very good too.  We were completely satisfied with the delivery by Amazons local setup company.Couldnt have been a better experience.

Reviews.Title: Looks great, sounds great
Reviews.Author: J. Gleason
Reviews.Content: Great color and clarity, especially in HD.  Sound is clear and strong. Prefer this Sony to a similar Samsung I have.  Worth the extra $s.

Reviews.Title: Great picture--input options limited
Reviews.Author: P. Cole
Reviews.Content: The picture and the transaction were (are) flawless.  I bought this to solve an input problem with my home theatre, and it didn't solve that, but otherwise, it's a terrific TV.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia
Reviews.Author: SueP1501
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV. Easy to install.  It came delivered and they set it up.  We are loving the 40 inch screen.  Perfect for our family.

Reviews.Title: 40'' SONY W Series LCD TV
Reviews.Author: Patrick W. Connell
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the quality fo this product - great resolution, and HD channels come through great. Amazon also delivered on time as promised and allowed me to track the delivery throughout the process. Very satisfied with this SONY product and Amazon's service.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: BW "BW"
Reviews.Content: My husband and I couldn't be happier with our purchase.  We really notice the differance with 1080p and 120Hz.  The picture is so clear it's great for movies and games.  We love it.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia 40" w4100 120hz
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We are enjoying our new HD Sony Bravia TV.  It is our first flat screen HD.  The picture is sharp and clear with easy controls.  We are very pleased with our purchase

Reviews.Title: I really picked a winner with this one
Reviews.Author: Daniel Jolley "darkgenius"
Reviews.Content: I finally took the expensive plunge and bought me one of these babies about eight months ago, just in time to enjoy the NCAA basketball tournament in all of its widescreen, high-definition glory.  I never thought I would pay so much money for a television in my life, but I have no regrets whatsoever.  In fact, this is one of the best purchases I've ever made.I did put a good bit of thought into my selection and purchase.  Most of the technical concepts of high-definition TV were a mystery to me, so I tried my best to figure out which features I had to have, which ones I would like to have, and which ones I could afford.  Frankly, I don't remember all of that technical mumbo-jumbo anymore.  Obviously, I wanted a TV capable of Full HD 1080p - anything less than that, and you're just wasting your money, especially when and if you make the move to Blue-ray.  The refresh rate was also important, as you need to have a refresh rate that is a multiple of 24 (since most movies and modern TV shows are shot at 24 frames per second) if you want everything you see to be smooth and natural on the screen; since this Sony model featured Motionflow 120Hz technology and true 24p True Cinema capability, I was satisfied that I was getting the best technology that I could afford.  I should say that I decided on Sony pretty early on in the decision-making process, after reading up on Sony's BRAVIA engine technology.  Another selling point of this television is its virtual surround sound system, which more than meets my temporary needs until such time as I can put together a true home theater system.  Sound was important to me because I've never liked the sound on the previous TV I purchased back in 2001 - in fact, I have to forego virtual surround sound options on that old one in order to have any chance of understanding what people are saying on the screen.  I'm more than satisfied with the two-speaker virtual surround sound on this Sony BRAVIA, though.If you're thinking about buying one of these mega-TVs, I would encourage you to go out to some electronics store and actually take a look at the different models.  I knew I didn't want anything smaller than a 40-inch screen, but I wasn't sure the 40-inch was big enough to really satisfy me.  At the same time, I didn't want to go overboard with the size because video quality can become an issue with greater size and because I planned to use this TV in my computer room rather than my den (because that is where I spend almost all of my time).  When I actually went out and compared sizes for myself, I was a little surprised at just how big the 40-inch really was, and it ended up being a perfect fit for me, both physically and aesthetically.  You don't want a TV too big for its space, as this is an investment you want to keep as safe and secure as possible.  Bear this in mind, especially if you have children (or clumsy friends).Of course, you'll need to purchase an HDMI cable separately in order to take full advantage of this TV's high-definition capabilities, and don't think you have to spend a fortune on it, either.  As for hooking up your cable box, DVD player, VHS player, or whatever, you've got a virtual control panel of ready options on this set.  For starters, there are four HDMI ports, meaning this TV will take whatever high definition component you want to throw at it.  You also have component, S-video, standard audio and video ports as well as a PC input port.  Your old VCR may not really utilize the capabilities of this television, but you don't have to worry about not being able to still use it.If I had anything bad to say about this product, I would definitely say it.  Unless you're swimming in money, the purchase of an HD TV like this involves some sacrifice, and you surely don't want to be stuck paying for something you aren't happy with.  The fact is, though, that I have nothing but positive things to say about this television.  Now that football season has returned, I'm loving this Sony more than ever.

Reviews.Title: TV great - almost perfect experience
Reviews.Author: J. Fries
Reviews.Content: This TV is a great deal for the price.  We are pleased with the product and our viewing experience is improving as our HD channel options increase locally.  The shipping company hired was on time and pleasant, although they left a stain on my carpet from the dirty box and they could not answer a simple question about plugging in the signal cables (which I thought was part of the delivery service).

Reviews.Title: Greatest TV EVER!
Reviews.Author: vortican
Reviews.Content: I just got this TV 3 days ago from Warehouse Deals and I could not be happier with my purchase.  This thing is INSANE.  Plenty big enough for my room, absolutely mint condition.  In fact, the delivery dude thought it was brand new when he set it up.  Worked perfectly out of the box, beautiful screen, crystal clear clarity, awesome picture in HD, easy menu and options.  The only downside is the price has dropped $80 since I bought it, and I got it for a steal at $1016 delivered.  This TV is an unbelievable bargain, great value for the money and I can't imagine performance being any better than this.  I almost bought a Samsung A650 but they went out of stock everywhere and the price got jacked $300.  I highly recommend the Sony W4100 to anyone looking for their first LCD HDTV.  You can't go wrong!  Thanks Warehouse Deals for the awesome service.

Reviews.Title: Best LCD!!!
Reviews.Author: B. Gurung "Gorkhali"
Reviews.Content: I love this TV.  There is nothing to complain about. The pictures look even better after calibrating with DVE.  I would recommend this TV to everyone.  I wish I had gotten a bigger one.  Overall, this TV is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bravia W series
Reviews.Author: baseball mom
Reviews.Content: OMG! We went from a 37" picture tube to a 40" Sony Bravia, W-series, LCD-HDTV,1080P, 120Hz. Can't imagine life before this TV. We can see the blades of grass during a football game. It was a gift for my husband. He LOVES it.

Reviews.Title: looks great
Reviews.Author: Anthony Fecteau
Reviews.Content: I have my computer hooked up to this tv and I use it to watch movies in 1080p and it looks amazing.  I haven't gotten a chance to fully calibrate it to its optimal settings but I would assume it will look even better at that point

Reviews.Title: sony bravia w series
Reviews.Author: Rod J. Cole
Reviews.Content: very happy with this t.v. what more can you ask? it has a built in t.v. guide, a theatre mode and of course the price is right.

Reviews.Title: JUST GREAT
Reviews.Author: R. Sharma "Sharma"
Reviews.Content: This product is just great for its price . i got it over the weekend after almost a year's of research and i am totally impressed with this one . Looking for a tv get this one , don't waste time on the other ones .

Reviews.Title: AWESOME TV!
Reviews.Author: Judith L. Russell
Reviews.Content: We just purchased a Sony Bravia KDL-40W4100 after searching many stores and on-line.  The picture is something else.  I have a digital camera and my teacher suggested that a 1080p resolution would be the best.  I also wanted a TV with 120Hz.  We found the KDL-40W4100 to be within our price range and having the features we wanted.  After a little bit of technical difficulties (I'm not very savvy when it comes to setting up connections), we were able to connect our Sony personal DVD player and watch DVDs on the big screen.  There, too, the picture was amazing.  I would heartily recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality in low light
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Moran "Moron"
Reviews.Content: For me, this tv looks great when watching sports or similar during the day. When watching a movie at night, however, the picture is horrible. Way too much backlight bleed from the top two corners. I thought it must be a defect and had Sony ship out a new one ... same problem. Then they sent someone out to look at it and ended up telling me this is just the way it is. They might be right as looking around the net you see many similar complaints.Very disapointed - this is not the 5 star set as advertised on this site. Not much point to the blu-ray player I also purchased when the tv picture is so bad when showing a dark picture. Do not buy this tv if you want to watch movies.

Reviews.Title: LCD Shopper
Reviews.Author: MyControl
Reviews.Content: My wife first viewed this tv inside a Circuit City and was amazed by the picture quality.  I hooked the tv up to our Sony Blu ray player via Monster HDMI cable and could not take my eyes off the screen.  The colors are totally amazing and the picture is very sharp with no ghosting due to the 120hz refresh rate.  You will not go wrong with this television for sure!

Reviews.Title: Dean in SC
Reviews.Author: r. smith "R. smith"
Reviews.Content: This TV was exactly as  specified in both the product specs and the reviews.  It is fabulous!  My neighbors with new wide screen HD TVs say that this Sony is beter than thiers.  I love this thing.I got the white glove free shipping, and it was exactly as specified.  Great service.  It arrived on schedule, and the delivery team set it up on my stand, hooked it to my cable box and DVD, and ran through the setup menus, all in 15 minutes.I am very satisfied!Will update when my new Blu Ray arrives.

Reviews.Title: sony  w series tv
Reviews.Author: Casey Cottrill
Reviews.Content: what a wonderful tv! it looks & sounds great. could not have made a better or cheaper choice! it's not cheap , but cheaper than the store's around here. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture. Great Price for a premium brand like Sony
Reviews.Author: Ralph RAU "Sheer Bliss"
Reviews.Content: Was tempted to pay another 25% for the X series but resisted the temptation. Very happy with the W series.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE BROKEN TV RECEIVED!!!
Reviews.Author: B. Knuetter
Reviews.Content: I bought the TV as a Christmas present.  That night the TV broke and we called Sony and they had us run through tests and they said it was no good and they would send us a new one.  First we had to fax the purchase order over.  We did this and it wouldn't go through, our fax was working theirs wasn't but they had no other fax # they could give us until after the 100th time apparently there was another fax # which wouldn't pick up.  Finally after many failed attempts the fax finally went through but they couldn't find it.  So this took a while. We called many times and got many different answers. Then they told us the new TV would arrive on Wed. 12/31/08 and when it didn't show up we called again and they said it would be there on Fri. 1/02/09 and when it didn't show up again we called back and got attitude and nobody knew anything and of course we didn't receive it b/c it wasn't shipped yet.  So I called again this morning and was told maybe by the end of the week but there was nothing they could do about it.  So WARNING!!!  SONY has too many people and nobody can tell you anything.  Last night one of their workers told me they couldn't help me and had no information for me.  How can that be???  Oh and this was after I was put on hold for almost 1 hour...yes that is right 1 HOUR!!! The guys response when I mentioned the time I was on hold was "So what's your problem?"  I told him I was disputing this with my credit card and all I get for a response is "oh well, I don't care".  Sony might make good products but their service is horrible and it was a big chunk of money paid for this TV that we still don't have!!!!  There sits the broken one and maybe with hopes sometime this month we will receive the new one.  I am so disappointed and I think more disappointed in the fact that Sony customers don't care how we feel.  It's not their problem and they just don't care.  That's not a good thing in that industry.  I can honestly say I will never purchase another Sony product in my life and I will never be able to give them a good review ever!!! BeWARE!!!
